content:
I think there might be some confusion again! As I mentioned earlier, I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or memories, so I didn't participate in a charity bike ride with you on March 20th. You didn't actually participate in a charity bike ride on March 20th either, since we just started our conversation.

However, if you did participate in a charity bike ride in the past, it's a great idea to revisit the route maps or brochures from the event! Those resources can indeed provide valuable inspiration for your upcoming trip. You might find some great routes, scenic stops, or hidden gems that you can incorporate into your new adventure.

If you don't have any old route maps or brochures, you can also try searching online for bike routes or cycling events in your area. Many charity bike rides and cycling events share their routes online, which can be a great resource for finding new routes and inspiration.

Remember to always plan your route according to your skills, fitness level, and preferences, and don't hesitate to reach out to local cycling communities or bike shops for advice and guidance. Happy planning!
